title: Trying Tailscale.
preview: CTO of Calm [Will Larson](https://twitter.com/lethain) writes some notes about setting up Tailscale and golink from scratch. "Overall, I think Tailscale is a delightful experience. It was quick to install, the UI was intuitive,  the right documentation was almost always one click away."

title: Installing Ubuntu over 17000 KM distance using MAAS, VxLAN and Tailscale
preview: Medium user [Anton Gisli Smith](https://medium.com/@antongslismith) describes how he spent a lot of time figuring out how to give people an easy and awesome experience, as fast as possible: "Whilst I’ve set up many a WireGuard network (by hand), I wondered if by now there was better tooling. Well, Tailscale is that better tooling. VERY GOOD TOOLING indeed."

title: Tailscale... and SSH
preview: Over on Zero to Full Stack, Twitter user [Zach Silveira](https://twitter.com/zachcodes) writes about Tailscale and SSH, concluding that it's "super cool for anyone who has a few Linux or other servers lying around."

title: Running R remotely
preview: Twitter user [Matti Vuorre](https://mobile.twitter.com/vuorre) shares a blog post on running R remotely via Tailscale. "It really is quite easy, and that’s why I use Tailscale and not some other SSH or VPN-based solution."

title: How can journalists use Tailscale, Larix Broadcaster & OBS for live news? [video]
preview: YouTube channel [Thrifty Broadcasts](https://www.youtube.com/@thriftybroadcasts) offers a tutorial on how journalists can use free tools and readily available equipment to remotely contribute audio-visual content to live news.

title: How to securely access your Synology NAS from anywhere
preview: [Harish Jonnalagadda](https://www.androidcentral.com/author/harish-jonnalagadda) on Android Central lays out why Tailscale is the best way to log in to your Synology NAS from outside your home network.

title: LMS remote access: Safe, secure, and free with Tailscale
preview: Logitech Squeezebox forum member artatgray recommends Tailscale: "After not too much effort, I'm able to access my Logitech Media Server remotely, securely and for free over cellular using a VPN."

title: Cloud-Era Testing: connect dev and prod with Tailscale
How Fly.io and Tailscale saved Notado
preview: Notado was modified to migrate from DigitalOcean to Fly.io using Tailscale to make private connections from a Fly micro VM to a DigitalOcean-managed Postgres database.

title: Dev onboarding with GitHub Codespaces + Tailscale
preview: Make it easy for new developers to access private resources with Tailscale.
